title: Cuyahoga Valley National Park: News Releases
body: News Releases           Subscribe  | What is RSS     February 17, 2016  Cuyahoga Valley National Park Celebrates 100th Anniversary of National Park Service  Cuyahoga Valley National Park is inviting everybody to celebrate the National Park Service Centennial with more than 100 things to do – special concerts, picnics, and train rides, plus everyday activities like hiking, biking and more.   January 29, 2016  Cuyahoga Valley National Park Remains Eleventh in Visitation  Visitation at America’s national parks broke all-time records in 2015 as the National Park Service has been celebrating its 2016 Centennial with a major push to encourage more visitors to experience their national parks.   November 02, 2015  First Phase of East Rim Mountain Bike Trail Opens in Cuyahoga Valley National Park  The National Park Service has announced the opening of the first phase of Cuyahoga Valley National Park’s first mountain biking trail. A grand celebration of the first phase will occur in spring 2016.   September 02, 2015  National Park Welcomes 4th Graders Through Every Kid in a Park Initiative  The National Park Service invites all 4th grade students to visit for free the James A. Garfield National Historic Site (NHS),  First Ladies National Historic Site (NHS), and Cuyahoga Valley National Park (CVNP) as part of the White House’s new Every Kid in a Park program.   August 25, 2015  Find Your Park and Celebrate the 99th Birthday of the National Park Service  The National Park Service is turning 99 years old on August 25 and Cuyahoga Valley National Park, James A. Garfield National Historic Site (NHS), and First Ladies National Historic Site (NHS) want you to join the party! Come to the parks and take a hike with a ranger, visit the historic home of the 20th President of the United States (POTUS), or experience the history of the First Ladies Library.
